channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Russia Asks United States to Stop Pursuit of Fleeing Oil Tanker
item.description: The tanker, which had been sailing to Venezuela to pick up oil, has claimed Russian protection, although the U.S. authorities say it is a stateless ve...

item.title: Negative prices for electricity are getting more common in Europe and consumer costs have dipped—while Americans face rising energy bills
item.description: By September, the number of hours in Spain with negative prices had already topped 500 for the year to date, more than double the full-year total for ...

item.title: Venezuela Frees Dozens of Political Prisoners
item.description: At least 80 people were released, including one with U.S. ties, though more than 800 remain detained in Venezuela for opposing President Nicolás Madur...

item.title: Guinea’s Coup Leader Wins Election After Barring Leading Opponents
item.description: Gen. Mamady Doumbouya, who seized power more than four years ago, took over 80 percent of the vote, according to a government-controlled agency that h...

item.title: Mark Cuban says he doesn’t do calls and prefers email because ‘if we do it by phone, I’m going to forget half the stuff that we talked about’
item.description: Meanwhile, Gen Zers prefer email or text because of their anxiety about talking on the phone.

item.title: CEOs say they are unplugging from the top job by cancelling all meetings and playing with Legos over the holidays
item.description: The leaders behind tech companies and multimillion-dollar cookie empires weigh in on work-life balance during the holidays—from strict screen time lim...

item.title: The Two Questions I Wish We’d Stop Asking in 2026
item.description: How did we get here? I don’t want to know.

item.title: Feds are hunting teenage hacking groups like ‘Scattered Spider’ who have targeted $1 trillion worth of the Fortune 500 since 2022
item.description: Rogue teens have attacked some 120 companies—including Nike, Chick-fil-A, Instacart, and News Corporation—often posing as IT staff.

item.title: It’s New Year’s Day 2026. What’s open and closed?
item.description: Most federal services are shuttered, but the retail landscape remains mixed.

item.title: Iran Protests Turn Deadly as Violence and Anger Spread
item.description: Financial pressures have fueled a fifth day of demonstrations around Iran, with at least one person killed in the protests so far, according to the au...

item.title: Live Updates: Dozens Confirmed Dead in Fire at New Year’s Party in Swiss Alps
item.description: The local police said that their preliminary toll was about 40 dead, with roughly 115 injured, in the early morning blaze at a bar in the resort town ...

item.title: Fire in Swiss Alps Leaves Dozens of New Year’s Revelers Dead
item.description: About 40 people celebrating at a ski resort bar were killed, and 115 were injured, many of them young, the authorities said.
